title: Mexican authorities arrest 5 people linked to kidnappings of 4 Americans, official says
description: Arrest warrants have been executed against five people linked to last week’s kidnappings and slayings of Americans near the Brownsville, Texas, border, a Mexican official said.

title: Dutch historian discovers medieval treasure using metal detector
description: A Dutch historian has found a unique 1,000-year-old medieval golden jewelry treasure, the Dutch National Museum of Antiquities announced on Thursday.

title: Archrivals Iran and Saudi Arabia agree to restore ties after years of tensions
description: Iran and Saudi Arabia agreed Friday to restore diplomatic relations, a surprise breakthrough after talks in China that follow years of soaring tensions between the regional rivals.

title: Kim Jong Un supervises North Korean troops simulating attack on South
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervised a live-fire artillery drill simulating an attack on South Korea and called for his troops to be ready in case of war.

title: Xi Jinping is awarded third term as Chinese president, extending rule
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping was awarded a third five-year term as president Friday, putting him on track to stay in power for life.

title: Deaths reported after shooting at Jehovah's Witness hall in Germany
description: Deaths were reported Thursday after shots were fired at a building used by Jehovah’s Witnesses in Hamburg, Germany, police said.

title: Russian missile barrage hits Ukrainian power plant and key energy infrastructure
description: A suspected hypersonic missile struck a power plant in the heart of Kyiv as Russia launched a barrage of missile attacks across Ukraine. NBC News’ Erin McLaughlin has the latest updates on the war.
